content: Great game, poor ui.

The UI is clearly meant for a tablet as it is very nearly unplayable on phone (and I mean that literally and without embellishment). Possibly the worst app implementation of a board game that I have encountered.
Very buggy and lacking basic explanation / intuitive gameplay
replyContent: Hi, we are always looking to improve the experience for our users, and really appreciate the feedback. If there is anything specific we can look into, please contact us at bugs@beziergames.com.

content: This is a good implementation of the game. Hadn't previously noted the drop-down element of the top menu.
replyContent: Could you kindly tell us more about the problem you are facing at bugs@beziergames.com? Thanks.

content: Please add the ability to access a detailed score breakdown explaining how the turn's score was calculated.

I love the board game that I have in collector edition. I also love the app. I only wish my screen will be bigger to see more of my city I have a favour to ask. I am after a code to get suburbia on ios but I forgot to get it during the campaign (I got the android on but not the iOS). Please come back to me I need this on my iPad !

Great port of the boardgame. The automatic calculations are great and the special edition tiles design make it much more interesting visually. The campaign mode is a great addition and will keep you busy for a while.
No online play. AI experience is pretty lonely for this one. Visuals are unremarkable. Also moving the field of view on the map keeps causing it to hang
No online play available
This app was great until they updated the graphics and made it an absolutely overdesigned mess.
replyContent: You are able to toggle between the old graphics and the new by clicking on the tile in the game setup page.

content: Lots of features and a robust, satisfying game.
Tricky to see on the phone but good city building game.

Won't let me long press to decrease volume. Leave the app for a while and the sounds and music are on. Just let me long press to decrease or increase volume, come on. I should not have to click click click. That's nuts. Why on Earth would you change how volume works? Maybe it's a bug? Fix for 4 stars. It's a fine app otherwise. Glad I can play with classic art, which I vastly prefer.

What a terrible app. The "campaign" is garbage with ill-defined rules and arbitrary end game triggers. I keep getting messages I have failed to connect a tole when I clearly have. Hire a better developer next time.
Edit: thanks! I'm updating my rating since this toggle does exist
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Were you aware that the old art for the tiles is still available by clicking on the tile in the top right of the New Game menu? You can toggle between artwork styles at any time.

content: Game seems to randomly decide whether or not tiles are connected in campaign mode. I've won games I should have lost and lost games that I should have won. Also, the game play itself is much more a game of luck than strategy. It really depends on who gets access to what tiles and which tiles were actually included in the deck each game. I was hoping for more of a strategy game. Also, navigation and readability leave a lot to be desired.

Had installed it on a Pixel 2. Game is playable but until it's updated to hide the on screen Android buttons (back, home, app switcher) then it'll remain uninstalled. Too many times I closed the app when trying to zoom on a tile in the market.
replyContent: We have not had this issue reported to us before, and we'd certainly like to work this through for you. Could you share the details at bugs@beziergames.com? And any relevant screenshots would be immensely valuable. Thank you.

content: I got this game free with the purchase of the CE Kickstarter boardgame. It has rapidly become one of my favourite games on my phone and lets me play through various strategies before receiving the final product. The only downside I can find is that there are still some AI improvements that need to be done. Like buying a tile that is available for +6 when the same tile is available for +0 and there isn't the goal of least money...

Great game and I've enjoyed the app, but after the latest update not only were all of my old saved games lost, but the only game I've saved since the update I could open. I could delete it accidentally trying to open it, but I couldn't actually open it no matter how many times I tapped.

A good implication of the board game. Would give it 5 stars if it included all expansions (Inc and 5-Star) and if there was a place in app to report bugs in game. The AI is buying tiles and going into negative money to do so. And Casino isn't working correctly when population goes backwards over a red line.
replyContent: Could you kindly tell us more about the problem you are facing at bugs@beziergames.com? We would like to resolve any issues the app may have. Thanks.

content: Has a aoftware bug in doing its additions. Cant measure lakes.
replyContent:
Hello Sue,
Thank you for your feedback. If you could send any details of issues that you have to bugs@beziergames.com, we would like to address them.

content: Very tricky puzzle game

This is an excellent implementation of the game! I especially like the campaign and its challenging scenarios! Some of the reviews mention having a hard time tracking the math according to the app, but I have checked it extensively and it is always right according to the rules. I like that the app lets me know the consequences of each action I take before I really take it. The game takes a few tries to really understand, but is worth the effort.
i was hoping it would have a tutorial so could learn the game instead of reading rules
Terrible game,I have myself 10 chances learn and trying to figure out how to play. The instruction is way too little. I wished there is an example or tutorial game. Oh well, uninstalling this game.

I backed the latest kickstarter and the app was free with backing. The app is terrible. There is no tutorial, that I have found and no online play. I have a game app that I need the real game for so I can learn how to play the app. I have only a few game apps on my phone. I have one puzzle style game the rest are board game apps that I can play online with friends or random people. It's why I got those apps. Why have pass and play when we can bust out the board game when we get it?
Great app. really enjoying the solo campaign challenges
This is not a review of the game, but of the app. It is pretty much unplayable in this version. Wait for an update.
saw the game on sale for free... started it up, read a bit. placed the tile and couldn't do anything after. The controls/layout needs reworked. The game hasn't been updated in 2.5 years...
Great example to show why you need to invest in UX
Wonderful immaculate game!
Encountered a bug which caused a win condition from failing to trigger. Pretty annoying. Quite fun, but needs serious QA work before it's worth picking up even for free.

This looked like an interesting strategy game. Unfortunately the design of this digital version is abysmal. It's slow and the interface is clumsy, but honestly I could look past all that. But then I scrolled too far from the board and now I'm "lost" in a white void! And this is a premium game? Immediately uninstalled.
Difficult to read on mobile. Instructions not easy to understand. Not fun.
confusing

Good game, fine adaptation but annoyingly buggy. Besides the zoom problem, I can't finish Atlanta. Objectives say connect all tiles, which I do, earn more than 10, same, and 30 Max inhabitants, and despite being either above or over, the connect all tiles and under 30 are both a fail every time... So you can't finish the campaign that way.
glitchy

The game itself is fun to play and the different levels and goals keep it challenging. However, this game can be quite buggy - a few times it has told me I've won and reached all the goals even when i didn't, and vice versa when i have reached all the goals it uses statistics completely different to the ones in my city and says i lost. Fix this issue and I'd give it 5* no doubt.
Clearly this is oriented towards people who already know how to play... No tutorial whatsoever to ease into the rules. There is a rulebook, but its not very user friendly or easy to read.
as a standalone this game needs a tutorial because ad it is this is impossible. if you already own the game then it is a fun way to play.
it's OK but the single player needs work. it is boring, overly difficult even on easy, and you can't unlock additional sets of cards without beating it. Fun at times but also frustrating.
Good implementation of the boardgame. Only downsides are the zoom bug which can be avoided easily if aware of it and some other unclear things that hopefully get fixed with the new KS funds.
the intro music needs to follow the mute setting on the game. just stop

The instructions are spotty and incomplete. For example, some tiles have liabilities that are not explained in the rules or tutorial. The tutorial is cursory and short. It desperately needs a late game move or two to show players how to think about that. The strategy section is laughable and there is no explanation of how red lines work. The interface works great and is easy to use and understand. Obviously I could enjoy this game if I could learn it, but that is not possible with it currently.
It takes 10 mins just to read the instructions. Way to complicated for a mobile game. play a couple of games before I decided not to bother.

The rules of this game are poorly explained and I was never able to figure out why certain values changed with certain moves. Ive heard good things about the board game, but this app is not a friendly introduction to it.

Grest game, but screen size issue is annoying, stops me playing the "local play" games on my new phone altogether as I can't see the button to start the game! I hope it gets fixed. I'd love to be able to play in portrait rather than landscape, there's nothing in the game that would prevent it.
shames me for having an 18:9 display

controls are pretty bad. as mentioned by others, if you drag the board and lose sight of any tiles, you cannot drag the playable area back into view. you are forced to quit the app and restart from scratch! since there hasnt been any updates for a long time, I don't think the app is worth playing in this state.

The underlying game itself is good. But this rating is purely for the app. Mechanics of the app seem to work fine. The instructions for the single player game are very bad. The first level says "Connect schools to the university". I've lost twice for not doing this. I'm assuming now that at least one school has to be directly adjacent to the university? I shouldn't have to guess what the win condition is! Improve the grammar so players don't have to guess how to win
Really enjoying this app. Improvements needed: * I can't find a setting to not blast music when the app opens. * It would really help if the the +/- symbols on numbers were larger.

there was a reason this app was free. The zoom bug will get every single one of your games and you will be unable to finish any of your games. You can accidentally zoom out so far your play area dissappears off the screen with no way to recover or even zoom back you will be forced to restart and lose everything.
Glitchy to the point of unplayable

Downloaded for free yesterday. Learning curve, for sure. Tutorial could be improved. Been playing the single player campaign, but had to exit out of a level a few times now because I can't bring the "town" back into his street zooming out. So while I'm sure it's fun if you understand what's happening, the zooming issue is really annoying. And I think the overall UI could be better implemented.
This is a good adaptation of the original game. The controls are a bit clunky, but I'm excited for the overhaul with the Collector's Edition!
Bots need to be improved a little, but overall a pretty good app :)

Cannot install game on a pixel 2. After pending over an hour downloading, it always errors out and tells you to try again. Which takes just as long.  On my Samsung tablet, on which I was able to install it, I cannot play it almost anywhere because there is no way to turn off extremely loud music. Can turn off "effects" but not completely silence the app, and music ignores Do Not Disturb too. This means I can't use the app ANYWHERE other people are who might be disturbed. This is unacceptable. Game is unusable if you can't silence it.
Okay, a more well thought out tutorial would have helped alot

Good game, but plenty of bugs! I found the tutorial under hints. It wouldve been better if the tutorial popped up as skippable when you first open the game. Second, zooming in means potentially losing position and lose the display of tiles all together, in other words it has happened multiple times where i zoom in and the tiles vanish. Then I'd have to exit and lose. A tile says "for every adjacent (whatever), +1 population" it also counts every single connected green tile. Fix the bugs please.

Good game, poor version of it. Up coming KS funds will hopefully improve the app, but currently way too many issues. So game breaking, many small issues, mostly with UI. Others it is easier to restart then resolve, like if you scroll the city off the screen, it is very time consuming to try and find it again.
Interesting idea, poor application
There's great potential but a tutorial would make it a 4 star game and more oleasing interface would even grant the game 5.
Horrible game play
Poor tutorial and interface kept ms from enjoying or really even underdrsnding this game.
I don't have any clue on what's going on.
Not playable on my mobile. The screen only occupies half of the screen and the viewport is bizarrely cropped.
No tutorial, barly an introduction and a huge interface that is not self explanatory :( But the game starts - because of that 2/5 *
Got this for free.Played for 10 mins.Uninstalled game after realising game not updated since late 2016.Dead game dead developer dont bother even when free.
Descent looking board game adaptation marred by lack of a tutorial.
No thank you

Adequate for a short play, the difficulty levels are way off though. Games are way too short, interface is far from intuitive, and there's nothing to really capture the players interest in terms of rewards.
suburbia is a great game.

No tutorial makes this one impossible for a new player to learn.  I've played Castles of Mad King Ludwig extensively so I could muddle through it but it was frustrating and not fun. Add a tutorial and I could see this being a 5 star game.  Unless you already know how to play the tabletop version, I would stay away from this one.

Vaguely worded win conditions mean you have to play levels repeatedly to guess-and-check what's wanted. If you zoom or pan, about half the time it leaves the game stuck in an unplayable view. This game is broken and in no way worth any charge.
It needs online multiplayer.

Good app version of the board game. Having trouble with zoom, though. When 
I zoom in and the board loses off the side, I can't get it back, forcing me 
to close the app. Frustrating to have to keep re-starting.

Ok so I tried to submit a bug report via email, but the email address isn't 
real. The game is fun but if you move the play area around to see where all 
the tiles are it's possible to move the tiles off screen and then you can't 
bring them back and you have to quit the game and restart.

Overall, decent implementation of Suburbia.  The single player campaigns are fun. There is no tutorial support, so recommend watching videos of Suburbia game play to learn how to play.  Main issue with interface is the inability to recenter the map to where the tiles are.  If the map gets panned/zoomed offscreen, there is no way to return to the tiles on the tableau.  Please fix!  Seems like a lot of people are raising the same issue.

Looks like a fun game if I could figure out how the $#!7 the game is played. Can you guys add a tutorial level, please? Also more than once when I was zooming in or out I "lost" the city hexes and had trouble finding it in the featureless white background. A center button that brings you back to the city center would be great. A tutorial level would definitely up my review.
Expansions, please!

It's the review based on the first glimpse of the game and I feel the text on those tile is unreadable.   It's 2018 and almost everyone has got a 18:9 screen display. Kindly update the text on the tiles to be easily readable and to have less strained eyes after the gameplay session.
Good port with varied single player challenges. Scrolling and zooming can be an issue.
Not sure what bug is everyone talking about. I have tried multiple games with no issues. Scrolling works fine. Great version of the board game. Recommend.

Decent game. Takes awhile to figure it out. The tutorial isn't super helpful. Would be nice if the game explained how reputation affects population, etc. Also bug after beating Essen on med and hard. I don't see the new city.
Pinch zoom once and the game board goes missing, no way to recenter the board and the game board goes missing
Bit fiddly on a phone, there doesn't appear to be a way to re centre the map, had to quit as I lost track of where the town was with a wayward swipe
Just as I remembered the boardgame. confusing, convoluted, non intuitive, boring as hell and a game for people who have been spared the fun gene from there genetic makeup!
The disappearing city is ridiculous. Please fix it!

I love this game in real life, and this isn't a bad implementation. But the zoom functionality has cost me a few games now, which is frustrating. It appears as if dev on this game is dead, so nothing will be done about it.

A great game but there seems to be an odd bug at the moment where it will minus off some money occasionally whilst the AI characters take their turn. Beyond that, it's a solid adaptation of a great game.

I keep trying to play it but it either crashes or after I lay a couple of tiles, the screen disappears and I can't get back to the layout. It is really frustrating that I paid money to enjoy this game and i can't even play it. Oh, and there is not even an online multiplayer option. I want my money back.

It's ok for an Android adaptation of a boardgame. Not really much in the way of graphics. The interface needs work, especially the pinch to zoom. It's a basic flaw that's been around for a while but I guess the app's dead at this point so forget about a fix.

The calculations seems to be overwhelming for a tabletop game, but it is ideal for a smartphone app. I love the campaigns, it provides a lot of challenges. Yeah, don't zoom if you don't want to lose the city, but that can be tolerated. I recommend it.

Good game but I prefer Castles of Mad King Ludwig. The two games are very similar but the other one is more interesting because of the different size pieces and completion bonuses.  However this game does offer a bit more strategy.  Buy the one that most interests you and you won't be disappointed. Lack of a tutorial makes this one a bit harder to learn. However fumbling around in the app is still better than having to read instructions in the physical version.
Can't load saved games. Zoom control sucks. Disappointing implementation of a great game.
Love this game. Hours of fun without having to set up and organise players to come over. Like all good board game apps it has a great single player campaign

The "zoom loses the board" is a huge issue. Not being able to contact the developer (emails bounce) is a huge issue. The website for the app is just a parked domain. I dearly hope they pay attention to the reviews and fix these issues soon.

It's a good game for the money, with a slick interface. Confusing at first, but worth sticking with. I'm surprised there's still no fix for bringing the map back when it accidentally gets panned/zoomed offscreen—something that many reviewers have mentioned.
Cool interface, and very challenging
Awful
Buggy app, zoom, and slow
The map centering bug (zoom out and lose your game, force an app restart, no mid game save file) is really frustrating.

I was worried that the app wouldn't work very well due to the white screen bug or readability problems, but I'm pleased to report that's not the case on my Moto X (2014) [As I don't need to zoom in and out, probably]. Everything runs smoothly and without issue. Gameplay is interesting and varied due to the variable goals. Stages in the single player campaign get appropriately difficult by the end (though, never overwhelmingly so).   The one thing I wish it had was online multiplayer, but hopefully that will be added (along with the expansions) before too much longer. I knew there was only local multiplayer going in, so no stars deducted.

Easy game to learn and good replayability.  All the little numbers and rules on each tile are easy to read, learn and remember, even on an LG G3 smartphone. Solid challenging board game implementation. -2 for poor zoom and pan implementation--if you zoom out too much the city shrinks into the corner and you can't even swipe it back into the middle of the window.   -1 for no instant save/resume when the app gets killed/restarted.
I can't even place my first tile, and there doesn't appear to be a tutorial.
If you move or zoom your city map out of view, you can't get back to it since you can't grab or pinch areas outside the hexes. Game ending bug.
After the 2 minutes the game would just crash, it's too bad because I really liked it, but if I can't play it... What's the point??
Game would be 5 stats if it wasn't for losing the map all the time. Very frustrating. You got our money, now read all the ratings! We all want you to fix the map. RECENTER BUTTON!

Have the board game and love being able to play by myself, with no mess to clean up, and quickly. My only complaint is that the zoom feature doesn't work well. I keep accidentally knocking my city off the screen and there's no way to get it back.
But too hard for my tiny brain
Liked it so much I bought the actual board game.
The game is cancelled quite interesting! However I would have loved to play it with people rather than the AI. Hopefully, the makers will do that in a later update.

A fun game mechanic and a good conversion. The single-player challenges are fun. Biggest complaint is that pinch-to-zoom doesn't track where you've touched correctly, and it is easy to zoom such that the draggable-area is off-screen, making it impossible to continue playing. (Nexus 6). Minor niggles: the menu fade-transitions are too slow; had one challenge game claim incorrectly that I'd failed to meet the "connect all tiles" goal.
Zoom doesn't work you can't zoom back in
It's a great puzzle game when plkayed alone, with tough but w(ith some luck) beatable scenarios. Provides a lot of entertainment!

I love board games. I love city builders. This game combines both perfectly. Nice adaptation. Would be nice to have a less cluttered version of the UI and possibly revamp the graphics from the original board game.
Absolutely outstanding implementation! I love the board game, and this app has exactly the same feel.  I don't care much for the Single Player Campaign, but the Computer AI's are fun and challenging.
Love the game,  but even with the sound option turned off,  the bezier games splash screen still plays music.  It has woken up the boyfriend more than once when I try to play the game in bed.
Fix the zoom though

Recommended for fans of SimCity and Carcassonne or Alhambra. Build a city tile by tile, each with varying costs and benefits. Think long term to win. Lots of single player challenges, an AI to play against, and online play. Unbeatable value. Why isn't this great game more popular?

Most of the time this game is well balanced but due to the randomness there are sometimes games which just don't go your way in single player. It would be nice if I could quickly restart those levels instead of having to exit out to the map and load back in.
Unplayable - seems entirely broken.
This game has terrible (nonexistant) instructions and doesn't make any sense. Pretty stupid actually. Can't make a play yet game won't end or let me skip turn to get income.

I was excited to see this game on here and really wanted to give it a shot, was very disappointed to find out that it doesn't play properly, waterfront realty was the most obvious that it doesn't cascade the bonus you're supposed to get, but this was noticeable on other buildings and caused me to lose games. Very unimpressed.
I bought the game yet I gotta win the single games to unlock. Granted I am a noob and it does take time to win. But you'd expect all cities to be open since I PAID for it!!
Easy levels are next to unwinnable and sometimes games are marked as lost even when all winning conditions are met.
I like strategy games. But this one blows
Looks and plays great on my tablet and my Moto Maxx 2.

Great game. Nice challenges but the pinch zoom and general board navigation are broken. You can only anchor on live played and playable tile spots. If you manage to zoom or slide this off the screen there is no obvious way to return to 'home'. Had to abandon games due to this bug.

Pinch zoom was erratic on my Sony Xperia.  The city tiles I was building drifted up and offscreen. No amount of pinching, dragging,  or cussing brought my city back on screen. Had to quit without finishing.
Love it. I play this more than the real game
It really need at better tutorial for players who are not familiar with the board game version.
I always leave comment under apps I tried (and refunded). I saw no comment here and bought it. then comment appears. No refund, and money lost on app I won't ever launch. sad
The vs computer will win every time due to luck of draw Always goes to computer. Computer also always plays to win your individual goal. Hope the developer chokes on my money. POS

Nice implementation of the game. The challenges can seem frustrating, but are beatable with a bit of planning and luck, and add a nice variation to the normal games. The AI games are a bit easy, but that's ok, I can play the it live if I want a real challenge. There's one bug that, when zooming out, might move the city out of screen and you can't get to it anymore. On a "local play" you can save and reload to see it, but on challenges you can't do that and are forced to quit. Fix that and it's a 5 star app.

Will upgrade to five stars when bugs are fixed (e.g. zoom out can be irreversible), all rules of original hand are implemented (pick secret goal from two), and there is online multiplayer so I can play with my friend in Portland while I'm in Seattle.
Pinch to zoom loses city.  No explanation of some scoring changes. Music plays on startup with no option to turn off.
Great game, and with competent AI, I'm happy to give 5 stars when they prevent sound when the game starts up, like the options should allow..
I love the board game and I think it is great that I have the ability to play it on my phone now
Zooming in to read tile caused the whole map to disappear I was unable to see my placed tiles even after trying to zoom out as completely as possible.

Good app, but some of the easy campaigns are hardly easy. Dozens of attempts and not even close to winning but on other campaign locations I can walk right past the goals. Too bad because the concept is splendid.
I really like the board game, but this app is way too buggy to be enjoyable.
Challenging but not to the point of throwing my android device though it crossed my mind when I first tried it.  Now even after countless plays and completing puzzle mode it is still my go to.
Very nice interface. Just don't zoom to be safe, thus the one star off.

My Android tablet seems to have serious problems with pinch-zoom and map movement. Got stuck unable to see the game board, couldn't place tiles, couldn't move the map. Additional problems with icon artifacts remaining when hiding panels. I would  like a fix or a refund.

City disappears if you zoom out too far and you can't get back to it. Just see white screen and have to quit and start over. Very frustrating. Love everything else. It's gorgeous and replicates the board game perfectly. But if this glitch isn't fixed then it's essentially broken and somewhat unplayable. Feels polished but unfinished as mentioned by other reviewers. Additionally, it really needs to be connected to Google Play Games. I want to rate 5 stars but can't until this bug is fixed.
.... and boring, boring, boring, boring, boring!!!! Graphics look like they belong on a  breakfast cereal packet. Instead try Race of nations (Through the ages), vastly better game for free.
Good implementation.    Wish it had an online async play option.

This game always locks up when I zoom out. In a paid app a bug like this is inexcuseable. The fact that many other users have pointed out the same bug and it is STILL unresolved is troubling. Do not waste money on this broken and ignored game.
A great app with a lot of cool single player options and the campaign is great, but it's missing multiplayer.
i love this game and own the board game as well as the android version. since the latest update, the tablet version is unplayable, the screen just flickers and dies. please fix!

The game is fun, but every game so far the map moves and all I see is white. It needs a recenter button to put the city back in the screen. Or if it just disappeared they need to fix that. No amount of zooming or panning gets you back and you are forced to start the game over.
Love the game play but my single player campaigns don't sync between my phone and my tablet.
Just be aware that tiles in place at start of campaign missions don't count as linked until you add a connecting tile!
Does not play anything like the board game. Single player campaign often marks you as failed despite fulfilling all the requirements. Feels unfinished.
I hadn't played the boardgame in quite a while, but the campaign got me back on that bicycle in no time.  It would be nice to be able to zoom, but fortunately, I can still play anyway.

I was interested in the board game and decided to buy the app first.  Glad I did. It's really fantastic and much easier to play.  So far I've had 3 games of pass and play while sitting on the couch with my buddy.  Not something you can do with a board game.  Another big plus is that app does all of the calculations  when you put down new tiles.  You can preview that changes and move the tile around a bit to look for a better placement before deciding to make it permanent.  Single player works well.  The campaign offers difficult goals to complete while removing two extra tiles each turn like a 3 player game.  It always removes the lowest two tiles, so you can't save them for later.  Hopefully they'll add the Suburbia Inc expansion as DLC in the future.  Oh, plus the recently announced 5 Star expansion.  Those would be an instant buy for me!  Some sort of companion mode for the board game to do all of the calculations would be nice, but that's probably asking too much.

This game has hexes in it. I got badly frightened by a hex once, so I was naturally apprehensive. However, I needn't have worried. This app is also a board game. I can't comment on how well it translates as the board game is never in print. I hope to see a copy one day, a story to pass onto my grandchildren...right, this game is good. It's also very addictive, which is why I uninstalled it. Is this review contrary? Yes, yes I believe it is...
Love the game. Short single player though.
Simply needs tp update rules in campaign mode to clarify that "connected" means connected thru a path of player placed tiles, not preexisting ones. Otherwise an excellent game.
The only flaw is you can't disable the launch music
I support any board game implementation on Android, but this one is especially worth the money
love the campaign as well as playing vs AI.

First and foremost, this game is great. It's a faithful recreation of the popular board game with a very nice interface that translates perfectly to the tablet. Compared to the price of the physical game, this is a *steal*.  I've been really enjoying the campaign mode and, as a new player, it's been a helpful tutorial on strategy. A frequent complaint about the campaign mode is that there's a bug in the tile connectivity. Having come across this a few times myself, I now at least understand what's happening; it may be a bug or maybe it's just a question of interpretation. The important point is this: the starting tiles on the board are not considered to be connected to one another _even if they're touching._ This means that if you have (as in Salt Lake City) a row of four lake tiles at one end and a stadium at the other, it's not enough to connect the "clump" of lake tiles to the stadium. Each lake tile must have a path, consisting of player-placed tiles, connecting it to the stadium tile. Of course multiple paths can use the same tiles, so in practice this means just one or two extra tiles to tie all of the lake tiles into the main path.
Needs more local play set-up randomness, but really fun!
Very interesting and fun game! I love it!  It is probably best to go over the rules briefly, then play for a bit, and then re-read the rules.
Please add customisable AI difficulty levels.
The rule book and the tutorial are pretty rubbish, but otherwise this is a nice implementation.
